acceptedDM: Your server profile has been set up. Your name is {{nickName}} and your target language is {{role}}.
newLang: New language role has been created.
newLangDM:
Hello again! 🤖 
 
It seems you're the first subtitler from your language pool to join us here, so an admin is going to have to set up a new language for you!
Please wait for an admin to contact you, which shouldn't take long. ⌛ 
 
Sassy,
Your friendly bot
waitForApproveDM: I've received your request to set up your server profile as {{nickName}} and a {{role}} linguist, and sent it to our admins. Please wait for approval. If you made a typo, you can always change your name using the **/nick** command later on.
error: I encountered an issue changing your nickname. It's probably due to the name you entered being more than 32 characters. Either type in a name which has less than 32 characters (we know you're good at condensing, you're a subtitler!) or use the **/suggest other** command if the issue persists.
rejectedDM:
Hi, <@{{user}}>!
 
It seems your **{{reason}}** did not match what we have in our records. Please go back to the <#{{reception}}> channel and try `/usersetup` again. If the issue continues, please use `/help` to contact one of our admins.
rejected:
<@{{user}}> has been rejected as {{nickName}}, and a <@&{{role}}> linguist. 
 
Reason: {{reason}}
setup.afterApproval:
Hello again!
 
This is Sassy, your friendly bot. 🤖 
 
You now have access to the server! 🥳
 
Please feel free to browse; <#{{discord101}}> is a good channel to start from if you're completely new to Discord. If you're already familiar with Discord, maybe we could interest you in the <#{{channelindex}}> channel to see which channel is used for what, or you could check one of our linguists' reading speed manifesto in the <#{{readingspeed}}> channel, and read previous LM-Plint meeting recaps in the <#{{lmmeetingrecaps}}> channel.
 
Also, I come with a bunch of commands to help everyone make the best out of the server!
 
If you're working on a project and want to collaborate with other people working on the same project, you can use `/buddyup` to join a project thread or `/requestadd` to request to be added to a manually assigned project channel by following the instructions in the bot-commands channel.
 
If you're having any issues with the server, you can use `/help` to get assistance from one of admins. 
 
You can find all this information and more in the <#{{botcommands}}> channel.
 
Happy subtitling!

welcome.message:
Hello, subtitler! 
 
Welcome to the Plint DTT Discord server. I'm the server's bot, Sassy. 🤖
 
Right now, you only have access to one channel called `Reception`. This is a waiting room for newcomers where you can set up your server profile and wait until an admin gives you access to the rest of the server.
 
All you have to do to set up your user profile is to:
 
✅  Go back to the <#{{reception}}> channel by clicking on the channel name here.
✅  Type `/usersetup`.
✅  Press space and enter your name when prompted. If you use a different version of your name from what you have registered with Plint, you can include it in brackets (i.e. 'Jonathan (Jon) Smith' or 'Jonathan Smith (Jon)' ). But please make sure your username doesn't exceed 32 characters.
✅  Press enter or tab and select your language from the list.
✅  Press enter.
 
If your language is not listed there, please select @new language and wait for an admin to contact you for more details.
 
After that, you can sit back and relax until an admin responds to your request. Once this happens, your nickname in the server is going to be automatically changed to the name you submitted. You will receive another message from me letting you know that you can now access the server, and I'm going to provide you with more information about how to use Discord and the server rules.
 
Happy subtitling!
welcome.title: Welcome!

messageMovedTo:
Hi, the following message you posted has been moved to <#{{channel}}>:
 
{{message}} {{attachment}}
messageCopiedTo:
Hi, the following message you posted has been copied to <#{{channel}}>:
 
{{message}} {{attachment}}
taggedBot: What is thy bidding, my master?
No, I wasn't translating, I swear!
Ph'nglui mglw'nafh Cthulhu R'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn.
Of all the gin joints in all the world, you walk into mine.
Make me an offer I can't refuse.
discordError: There has been an error. Blame Discord for this.
setParentError:
An error has occurred related to threads and channels. 
I assume you tried to create a thread inside a thread causing a 'threadception'; or entered a command that was meant to be used in a channel. Why would you even do that, you silly goose? 🤭
threadCreated: A new thread called "{{thread}}" has been created upon <@{{user}}>'s request. If you're working on the same project, use the command `/addme sass` now!
acceptThread: Do you accept to create or join to {{thread}}?

registered: Thank you! Your pronouns have been registered as {{pronoun}}.
removed: Thank you! {{pronoun}} has been removed from your profile.

enterProperName: The name you entered is somehow problematic.
noBuddyUpInProjectsChannel: You can't use `/buddyup` in this channel. If this is a project, try `/addme sass`.
willBeReplaced: Please note that `{{this}}` will be discontinued soon and will be replaced by `{{byThis}}`.

start: A voice session between <@{{establisher}}> and <@{{user}}> has been set-up here <#{{channel}}>.
end: A voice session named {{channelName}} has been ended.
notSession: This is not a private session. You cannot end it.
willStartAt: A voice session named {{channel}} between <@{{establisher}}> and <@{{user}}> will start at {{time}}.

channelRevamped:
This channel has been revamped by <@{{user}}>. All previous members have been removed.

**Reason:** {{reason}}
revampDM:
📝 Project Channel Update

The channel <#{{channel}}> has been closed and you have been removed from it.

If you receive any future project assignments that require access to a private channel, your project manager will provide specific instructions on how to join the appropriate channel.

⚠️ Please remember: For confidential projects, always use private channels to discuss access issues.
⚠️ Having issues with channel access? Use /help to get assistance privately.
confirmRevamp: Are you sure you want to revamp <#{{channel}}>? This will remove all members except admins and PMs.
confirmRevampArchived: Are you sure you want to revamp <#{{channel}}>? This channel is currently archived and will be unarchived first, then all members except admins and PMs will be removed.
invalidChannel: This command can only be used in project channels.

channelNotReady: This channel doesn't seem to be ready yet. Please check again later or contact the project manager for more information about the project "{{projectName}}".
invalidCredentials:
The project name and/or additional info you've provided doesn't match our records.

If you entered information from a PM's email:
- Please double-check both the project name and additional info carefully
- Make sure to copy them exactly as they appear in the email
- Try the command again with the verified information

If you haven't received an email from a PM:
- Please wait for an email with project access instructions
- The email will contain the exact project name and additional info you'll need

If you continue to have issues after verifying the information from your PM's email, you can use /help to contact an admin.
expiredCredentials: The access credentials for this project have expired. Please contact the project manager for updated credentials.
autoApproved: You now have access to <#{{channelId}}>! Your request was automatically approved based on the project credentials.
credentialRemoved: <@{{user}}> has removed access credentials for project "{{projectName}}".
autoApprovalLog:
<@{{user}}> has been automatically added to <#{{project}}> using verification code.

**Project Name:** {{projectName}} 
**Additional Info:** {{additionalInfo}}
